lereroLms: At Lerero, he played a crucial role in maintaining and developing new features for the LMS. One of his significant contributions was the creation of user management features, which consist of 5 access types, each offering over 60 selectable actions. He also focused on enhancing course modules and activity features, including SCORM integration. By leveraging best practices, he utilized Custom Hooks for feature development and implemented unit testing with JEST and React Testing Library, achieving a minimum coverage of 80%.
lereroMarketplace:
At Lerero, he is responsible for maintaining and developing new features for a fully responsive Marketplace. One of the key features is integration with Stripe to facilitate payment processes. By employing best practices in development, he utilizes Custom Hooks to create efficient and maintainable features. Additionally, he maintains checkout, category, and cart features to enhance the overall user experience. He works in a Scrum environment, collaborating with the team to effectively achieve sprint goals.

As part of the development process, he ensures code quality by implementing unit testing using JEST and React Testing Library, achieving a minimum coverage of 80%. With this approach, he ensures that every feature is not only functional but also reliable, making him a valuable asset to the team at Lerero.
